name.label: No I wont give a name.

content.label: I first bought this game in 2013. I loved the game back then and recently came across it again. I am surprised that EA optimized this app to work with newer iOS versions, but very happy. This game has the best driving mechanics I‚Äôve ever seen in any racing game on mobile to this day. The controls are simple to understand, but the cars have heft and feel good to drive and drift in. Collision doesn‚Äôt feel cheap either. The game is challenging, but with practice, you can learn to beat any hard race. The game reminds me of Racer mode from NFS Hot Pursuit (2010) but without the gadgets, which is one of my favorite Need for Speed‚Äôs of all time. Plus the app doesn‚Äôt have egregious micro-transactions that are necessary to progress. Even in 2020, I would recommend this game.

title.label: Not the the ‚ÄúMost Wanted‚Äù I was expecting

content.label:
Please, don‚Äôt waste your money on this game, please

First, it‚Äôs not the ‚Äúmost wanted‚Äù game I was expecting.
Moreover, it‚Äôs not even a good racing game. Not at all. 
I know, adding some some cops in the game makes it fun. However, adding too much cops a makes the experience extremely frustrating.
Even when I‚Äôm driving the McLaren, the cops driving Ford SUV can still reach me easily.
If you use the McLaren, the number one ‚Äú Most wanted‚Äù Lamborghini was soooo much easier to win then the second Viper. Which doesn‚Äôt make any sense.

Please, don‚Äôt buy this game.
